short_summary: A Tender for Expertise on the Condition of a Fishermen's Wharf in Quebec
description: PWGSC is issuing this demand of offers for the expertise on the condition of the Cap-aux-Meules fisherman’s wharf, as detailed in Annex Statement of work.
full_summary:
==- Government Tender Announcement ==-

**Procurement Reference**: WS4467221414-Doc4556048127

**Official Solicitation Number**: WS4467221414

**Publication Date**: 2024-05-01

**Tender Closing Date**: 2024-06-07T14:00:00

**Amendment Number**: 2 (Issued on 2024-05-24)

**Procurement Category**: SRV (Services)

**Notice Type**: Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding

**Subject**: Expertise on the condition of the Cap-Aux-Meules fishermen's wharf

**UNSPSC Classification**: 81101503 - Harbor or water ports engineering

**Government Trade Agreements**: Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
... (13 trade agreements listed)

**Region of Service Delivery**: Quebec (excluding the National Capital Region (NCR))

**Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada

**Contact Information**:
Cloutier, Annabelle (SPAC/PSPC)
Email: annabelle.cloutier@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Notice URL**: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19568718?extsite=MTk1Njg3MThfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

**Attachment**: None

This procurement notice invites qualified suppliers to submit proposals to provide expertise on the condition of the Cap-Aux-Meules fishermen's wharf. The successful supplier will be selected based on a combined rating of their technical merit and price.

The deadline for bid submission is June 7, 2024, at 2:00 PM EST. Only those bids received by this deadline will be considered.

Note:
- This is an expired tender and cannot be updated or re-issued
- The Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) are also included in the list of trade agreements
- The `endUserEntitiesName` and `endUserEntitiesAddress` fields are duplicates, but I did not include them in the rewritten output to maintain the word countboundary.
